subject: Photography
title: Emotional Color Palettes
description: A 60-second lesson on Emotional Color Palettes.

hook.text: Horror films use desaturated greens. Romances use warm pinks. Color palettes set the emotional stage.

buildup.text: Photographers and filmmakers choose palettes deliberately to evoke specific emotional responses in viewers.

discovery.text: Warm palettes (red, orange, yellow) create energy and intimacy. Cool palettes (blue, teal, gray) create distance.

twist.text: Breaking the expected palette creates unease. A wedding in cold blue or a funeral in warm gold feels wrong ‚Äî on purpose.

climax.text: Your color choices tell the viewer how to feel before they've read a single word or understood the subject.

punchline.text: Choose your palette. You're choosing the mood.

quiz.question: What emotional effect do warm color palettes create?
